alert.note: Alert for Bee; Live Oak; McMullen (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 9:07AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central McMullen, Live Oak and southwestern Bee Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 906 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near George West to 6 miles southwest of River Creek Acres to near Annarose. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... George West, Three Rivers, Argenta, Karon, Mount Lucas, Oakville, River Creek Acres, Simmons, Dinero, Clegg and Tynan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 40 and 67. US Highway 281 between mile markers 622 and 646. US Highway 59 between mile markers 700 and 744. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central Texas.
